page.title: 08Population, Staploe
page.content: Duloe, Staploe and Honeydon, originally grew up round 2 or 3 major farmsteads. Between them was a scattered pattern of smaller groups occupying a farmhouse, its buildings and one or two cottages. Essentially, this population distribution pattern has remained unchanged, despite the declining number engaged in agriculture and the balancing influx of commuting workers. The County Structure Plan maintains this situation in the face of pressure from continuous population growth in the neighbouring part of Cambridgeshire. There are approximately 100 households, of which about a quarter are totally retired; mostly ex-farm workers or their widows, living on in their tied cottages. 12 retired persons live alone. There are 300 persons-53 of schoolage or under.
